title: Why did Amy Winehouse have a black woman's voice? - Quora

response.answer_text: First of all, there is no objective “black woman voice”, there’s just a stereotype of it to which we’ve grown accustomed to, modeled after several singers and the musical genres they fell into. She didn’t, as far as I can tell. She had “black” phrasing and singing style, but in a blind test, I doubt you’d mistake her for a black singer, like a gospel singer or something. She absorbed the phrasing and style of the music she liked and listened to, and chose her repertoire accordingly — a bit like Joss Stone. I don’t think their voices are “black” — in a general sense, of course — they’re richer in the higher frequency range, and therefore can be more “raspy” than your typical black singer stereotype, who to my ear features more even harmonics. Among men, Tom Jones is a similar case — in part of his range he might be mistaken for a black singer, other times he sounds different.
